subject: Sexual Health
title: Building Resilience in Teens
description: A micro-lesson that makes Building Resilience in Teens usable.

hook.text: Teens who develop resilience during puberty handle stress, setbacks, and change better throughout life.

buildup.text: Resilience is not innate. It is built through supportive relationships, coping skills, and manageable challenges.

discovery.text: Having at least one trusted adult relationship is the single strongest predictor of teen resilience.

twist.text: Overprotecting teens from all discomfort actually weakens resilience by removing opportunities to develop coping skills.

climax.text: Supporting teens through puberty means offering guidance and safety while still allowing room to struggle and grow.

punchline.text: Resilience is built, not born. One trusted adult helps most.

quiz.question: What is the strongest predictor of teen resilience?
options: At least one trusted adult relationship
